title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: gvcAnalyzer package implements two complementary frameworks measuring global value chain (GVC) participation: Trade-Based (BM 2025 Trade): Decomposition gross exports. Output-Based (BM 2025 Output): Decomposition gross production. vignette compares approaches, demonstrating measure appropriate provide complementary insights GVC integration.

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: Borin, ., & Mancini, M. (2023). Measuring Matters Global Value Chains Value-Added Trade. Journal International Economics. Borin, ., & Mancini, M. (2025). Measuring Matters Value-Added Trade: Output-Based Approach. Working Paper.

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: trade-based framework decomposes gross exports country s country r GVC components: DAVAX: Traditional trade (domestic value added absorbed abroad one crossing) GVC_PF: Pure-forward GVC (domestic value added re-exported partner) GVC_TS: Two-sided GVC (foreign inputs re-export linkages) GVC_PB: Pure-backward GVC (foreign value added exports) Key feature: Measures much country’s exports participate GVCs.

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: output-based framework decomposes gross output country s production components: DomX: Purely domestic production (value never crossing borders) TradX: Traditional one-crossing trade GVC_PF_X: Pure-forward GVC-related output GVC_TS_X: Two-sided GVC-related output GVC_PB_X: Pure-backward GVC-related output Key feature: Measures much country’s production GVC-related, regardless export destination.

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
code: io <- bm_build_io(   Z         = bm_toy_Z,   Y         = bm_toy_Y,   VA        = bm_toy_VA,   X         = bm_toy_X,   countries = bm_toy_countries,   sectors   = bm_toy_sectors )

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
code: trade_meas <- bm_2025_trade_measures(io) trade_meas[, c("exporter", "share_GVC_trade", "share_PF_trade",                 "share_TS_trade", "share_PB_trade", "forward_trade")] #>   exporter share_GVC_trade share_PF_trade share_TS_trade share_PB_trade #> 1    China       0.1756661      0.1984122     0.03284796      0.7687398 #> 2    India       0.1785146      0.1811235     0.03352451      0.7853519 #> 3    Japan       0.1837284      0.3156778     0.04722529      0.6370969 #> 4      ROW       0.1904535      0.8021454     0.03153766      0.1663169 #>   forward_trade #> 1    -0.5703276 #> 2    -0.6042284 #> 3    -0.3214191 #> 4     0.6358285

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
code: out_meas <- bm_2025_output_measures(io) out_meas[, c("country", "share_GVC_output", "share_PF_output",               "share_TS_output", "share_PB_output", "forward_output")] #>   country share_GVC_output share_PF_output share_TS_output share_PB_output #> 1   China       0.06660911      0.03561645       0.8717403      0.09264324 #> 2   India       0.08629724      0.03848983       0.8508079      0.11070228 #> 3   Japan       0.07617141      0.06569826       0.8458922      0.08840956 #> 4     ROW       0.02552628      0.14810774       0.7660051      0.08588719 #>   forward_output #> 1    -0.05702680 #> 2    -0.07221245 #> 3    -0.02271129 #> 4     0.06222055

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: compare two frameworks, merge key indicators:
code: # Standardize column names trade_meas$country <- trade_meas$exporter comparison <- merge(   trade_meas[, c("country", "share_GVC_trade", "forward_trade")],   out_meas[, c("country", "share_GVC_output", "forward_output")],   by = "country" ) comparison #>   country share_GVC_trade forward_trade share_GVC_output forward_output #> 1   China       0.1756661    -0.5703276       0.06660911    -0.05702680 #> 2   India       0.1785146    -0.6042284       0.08629724    -0.07221245 #> 3   Japan       0.1837284    -0.3214191       0.07617141    -0.02271129 #> 4     ROW       0.1904535     0.6358285       0.02552628     0.06222055

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: share_GVC_trade: Share exports GVCs share_GVC_output: Share production GVCs forward_trade: Export-based forward orientation (positive = upstream supplier) forward_output: Production-based forward orientation

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
code: par(mar = c(5, 5, 3, 2)) plot(   comparison$share_GVC_trade,   comparison$share_GVC_output,   pch = 19,   col = "darkblue",   cex = 1.5,   xlab = "GVC Share of Exports (Trade)",   ylab = "GVC Share of Output (Output)",   main = "Trade-Based vs Output-Based GVC Participation",   xlim = c(0, max(comparison$share_GVC_trade, comparison$share_GVC_output, na.rm = TRUE) * 1.1),   ylim = c(0, max(comparison$share_GVC_trade, comparison$share_GVC_output, na.rm = TRUE) * 1.1) ) text(   comparison$share_GVC_trade,   comparison$share_GVC_output,   labels = comparison$country,   pos = 3,   cex = 0.8 ) abline(a = 0, b = 1, lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 2) grid()

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
code: par(mar = c(5, 5, 3, 2)) plot(   comparison$forward_trade,   comparison$forward_output,   pch = 19,   col = "darkgreen",   cex = 1.5,   xlab = "Forward Index - Exports",   ylab = "Forward Index - Output",   main = "Forward Orientation: Trade vs Production Perspective",   xlim = c(-1, 1),   ylim = c(-1, 1) ) text(   comparison$forward_trade,   comparison$forward_output,   labels = comparison$country,   pos = 3,   cex = 0.8 ) abline(h = 0, v = 0, lty = 2, col = "gray") abline(a = 0, b = 1, lty = 2, col = "red", lwd = 2) grid()

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025
text: vignette demonstrated complementarity trade-based output-based GVC measures. Trade-based measures ideal export competitiveness trade policy. Output-based measures ideal industrial policy sectoral analysis. together provide comprehensive assessment GVC integration. robust empirical research global value chains, recommend computing frameworks interpreting results light complementary strengths.

title: Trade vs Output Perspectives: Comparing BM 2023 and BM 2025

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 framework extends GVC measurement beyond trade flows production side, decomposing gross output GVC-related non-GVC components. vignette demonstrates output-based decomposition methodology.

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: Borin, ., Mancini, M., & Taglioni, D. (2025). Economic consequences trade global value chain integration: measurement perspective. World Bank Economic Review.

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 output decomposition classifies gross output country s : DomX: Purely domestic production (value added never crosses borders) TradX: Traditional one-crossing trade GVC_PF_X: Pure-forward GVC output (intermediates foreign production) GVC_PB_X: Pure-backward GVC output (using foreign intermediates) GVC_TSImp: Two-sided GVC output via imported intermediates GVC_TSDom: Two-sided GVC output via domestic intermediates GVC_TS_X: Total two-sided GVC output (TSImp + TSDom) GVC_X: Total GVC-related output (PF + PB + TS) fundamental identity: X_total = DomX + TradX + GVC_X.

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: output-based approach: Captures GVC involvement regardless export destination Provides production-side perspective complementary trade flows Enables sector-level analysis GVC integration Supports industrial policy analysis

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
code: io <- bm_build_io(   Z         = bm_toy_Z,   Y         = bm_toy_Y,   VA        = bm_toy_VA,   X         = bm_toy_X,   countries = bm_toy_countries,   sectors   = bm_toy_sectors )

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: row represents country’s gross output decomposition: X_total: Total gross output DomX: Production domestic final use TradX: Production traditional one-crossing trade GVC_PF_X: Production foreign intermediate use (upstream) GVC_PB_X: Production using foreign intermediates (downstream) GVC_TS_X: Production foreign inputs re-export linkages

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: components, compute participation indicators: Key indicators: share_GVC_output: GVC-related output share total output share_PF_output, share_TS_output, share_PB_output: Composition GVC output forward_output: Output-based forward orientation index

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 framework extends country–sector pairs:

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
code: # Example: Compare manufacturing sectors across countries # Note: Using column names specific to the sectoral function (X_i, share_GVC_output_i, etc.) manufacturing <- out_meas_sec[out_meas_sec$sector == "Manufacturing", ]  # Select key columns for display cols_to_show <- c("country", "sector", "X_i", "share_GVC_output_i", "forward_output_i") manufacturing[, cols_to_show] #>    country        sector      X_i share_GVC_output_i forward_output_i #> 2    China Manufacturing 16650390         0.13139144      -0.05196781 #> 5    India Manufacturing  1532351         0.14837417      -0.11484517 #> 8    Japan Manufacturing  2653472         0.12527693      -0.04804606 #> 11     ROW Manufacturing 26232285         0.03864037       0.08570681

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
code: par(mar = c(5, 5, 3, 2)) barplot(   out_meas$share_GVC_output,   names.arg = out_meas$country,   col = "steelblue",   ylab = "GVC Share of Output",   main = "Output-Based GVC Participation",   ylim = c(0, max(out_meas$share_GVC_output, na.rm = TRUE) * 1.2) ) grid()

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
code: par(mar = c(5, 5, 3, 2)) composition <- as.matrix(out_meas[, c("share_PF_output", "share_TS_output", "share_PB_output")]) rownames(composition) <- out_meas$country  barplot(   t(composition),   beside = FALSE,   col = c("darkgreen", "orange", "darkred"),   ylab = "Share of GVC Output",   main = "GVC Output Composition",   legend.text = c("Pure-Forward", "Two-Sided", "Pure-Backward"),   args.legend = list(x = "topright", bty = "n") ) grid()

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
code: par(mar = c(5, 5, 3, 2)) barplot(   out_meas$forward_output,   names.arg = out_meas$country,   col = ifelse(out_meas$forward_output > 0, "darkgreen", "darkred"),   ylab = "Forward Orientation Index",   main = "Output-Based Forward Orientation",   ylim = c(-1, 1) ) abline(h = 0, lty = 2, col = "gray", lwd = 2) grid()

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: sector-level aggregation matches direct country-level calculation, confirming consistency.
code: # Aggregate sector-level results to country level # Note: Using X_i and GVC_Xi for sector-level columns sec_agg <- aggregate(   cbind(X_i, GVC_Xi) ~ country,   data = out_comp_sec,   FUN = sum )  # Calculate implied country share from sector sums sec_agg$share_GVC_output <- sec_agg$GVC_Xi / sec_agg$X_i  # Compare with direct country-level calculation # CORRECTED: Using out_meas (which has the shares) instead of out_comp comparison <- merge(   out_meas[, c("country", "share_GVC_output")],   sec_agg[, c("country", "share_GVC_output")],   by = "country",   suffixes = c("_direct", "_sectoral") ) comparison #>   country share_GVC_output_direct share_GVC_output_sectoral #> 1   China              0.06660911                0.08441201 #> 2   India              0.08629724                0.07288443 #> 3   Japan              0.07617141                0.06459058 #> 4     ROW              0.02552628                0.02148852

title: BM 2025 Output-Based GVC Decomposition
text: vignette demonstrated BM 2025 output-based GVC decomposition: Country-level output components participation measures Sector-level decomposition detailed industrial analysis Visualization GVC participation orientation Consistency country sector aggregation output-based approach provides comprehensive view GVC integration production side, complementing trade-based measures robust GVC analysis.

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: gvcAnalyzer package implements two complementary methodologies measuring global value chain (GVC) participation: BM 2023: Measuring matters value-added trade (Bilateral Focus). BM 2025: Economic consequences trade global value chain integration (Tripartite & Output Focus). vignette demonstrates frameworks using four-country, three-sector input–output table. example includes China, India, Japan, Rest World (ROW), Primary, Manufacturing, Service sectors.

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: Borin, ., & Mancini, M. (2023). Measuring matters value-added trade. Economic Systems Research, 35(4), 586–613 Borin, ., Mancini, M., & Taglioni, D. (2025). Economic consequences trade global value chain integration: measurement perspective. World Bank Economic Review

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: package includes minimal MRIO table demonstration purposes:
code:
# Countries and sectors bm_toy_countries #> [1] "China" "India" "Japan" "ROW" bm_toy_sectors #> [1] "Primary"       "Manufacturing" "Service"  # Dimensions cat("Intermediate flows (Z):", paste(dim(bm_toy_Z), collapse = " × "), "
") #> Intermediate flows (Z): 12 × 12 cat("Final demand (Y):", paste(dim(bm_toy_Y), collapse = " × "), "
") #> Final demand (Y): 12 × 4 cat("Value added (VA):", length(bm_toy_VA), "industries
") #> Value added (VA): 12 industries cat("Gross output (X):", length(bm_toy_X), "industries
") #> Gross output (X): 12 industries

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: gvcAnalyzer functions operate bm_io object contains structured IO data derived matrices: bm_io object includes: Technical coefficient matrix Global Leontief inverse B Value-added coefficient vector v Country-level domestic Leontief inverses L
code: io <- bm_build_io(   Z         = bm_toy_Z,   Y         = bm_toy_Y,   VA        = bm_toy_VA,   X         = bm_toy_X,   countries = bm_toy_countries,   sectors   = bm_toy_sectors )  # Structure io$G    # number of countries #> [1] 4 io$N    # number of sectors #> [1] 3 io$GN   # total industries #> [1] 12

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2023 framework focuses precise accounting value-added bilateral trade, distinguishing source sink perspectives.

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: exporting country s, gross exports decomposed : DVA_s: Domestic value added FVA_s: Foreign value added DDC_s: Double-counted domestic content FDC_s: Double-counted foreign content

previous_headings: BM 2023: Detailed Bilateral Decomposition > Bilateral Decomposition
title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: source-based decomposition tracks value added country origin bilateral trade flows:
code: # Exports from China to India bm_2023_bilateral_source(io, 1, 2) #>   exporter importer DVAsource_sr DDCsource_sr FVAsource_sr FDCsource_sr EX_sr #> 1    China    India     77542.28      300.136     12376.79     48.74709 90268

previous_headings: BM 2023: Detailed Bilateral Decomposition > Bilateral Decomposition
title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: pure decomposition isolates direct bilateral value-added flows, excluding third-country effects:
code: bm_2023_bilateral_pure(io, 1, 2) #>   exporter importer DVA_star_sr DDC_star_sr FVA_star_sr FDC_star_sr EX_sr #> 1    China    India    77838.34    4.075798    12424.87   0.6656287 90268

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 framework introduces “Tripartite” concept (Forward, Backward, Two-Sided) extends GVC measurement production side.

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: tripartite decomposition classifies bilateral exports traditional trade three types GVC-related trade: DAVAX: Traditional trade (one-crossing domestic value added absorbed abroad) GVC_PF: Pure-forward GVC trade (domestic value added re-exported partner) GVC_TS: Two-sided GVC trade (simultaneous use foreign inputs re-export) GVC_PB: Pure-backward GVC trade (foreign value added exports)
code: # Single bilateral pair (China -> India) bm_2025_tripartite_trade(io, 1, 2) #>   exporter importer  E_sr DAVAX_sr   GVC_sr   GVC_PF   GVC_TS   GVC_PB #> 1    China    India 90268 69106.63 21161.37 8435.702 1403.456 11322.22

previous_headings: BM 2025: Tripartite & Output Decomposition > Tripartite GVC Trade Decomposition
title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: Summing destination countries provides exporter-level GVC trade components:

previous_headings: BM 2025: Tripartite & Output Decomposition > Tripartite GVC Trade Decomposition
title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: components, compute trade-based participation measures: Key indicators: share_GVC_trade: Share exports GVC-related share_PF_trade, share_TS_trade, share_PB_trade: Composition GVC trade forward_trade: Forward orientation index = (GVC_PF − GVC_PB) / GVC positive forward_trade indicates upstream positioning (supplier intermediates), negative values indicate downstream positioning (assembler using foreign inputs).

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 framework measures GVC participation production side, decomposing gross output rather exports.

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: country s, gross output decomposed : DomX: Purely domestic production (value added never crossing borders) TradX: Traditional one-crossing trade GVC_PF_X: Pure-forward GVC output GVC_PB_X: Pure-backward GVC output GVC_TSImp: Two-sided GVC output via imported intermediates GVC_TSDom: Two-sided GVC output via domestic intermediates GVC_TS_X: Total two-sided GVC output GVC_X: Total GVC-related output identity holds: X_total = DomX + TradX + GVC_X

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: output components, derive participation indicators analogous trade-based measures: Key indicators: share_GVC_output: GVC-related output share total output share_PF_output, share_TS_output, share_PB_output: Composition GVC output forward_output: Output-based forward orientation index

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: BM 2025 framework extends country–sector pairs proportional allocation based sectoral output shares:

title: Introduction to gvcAnalyzer: BM 2023 and BM 2025 GVC Decomposition
text: vignette introduced gvcAnalyzer package demonstrated: Construction bm_io object multi-regional input–output data BM 2023 bilateral decompositions precise accounting BM 2025 tripartite trade decomposition GVC roles BM 2025 output-based decomposition production-side analysis empirical applications, users can replace toy data full MRIO tables (e.g., WIOD, OECD-ICIO, ADB-MRIO) following workflow.

title: Build a bm_io object from IO table blocks — bm_build_io
code: bm_build_io(Z, Y, VA, X, countries, sectors)

title: Build a bm_io object from IO table blocks — bm_build_io
text: Z Intermediate demand matrix (GN x GN). Y Final demand matrix. Can (GN x G) (GN x (G * FD_categories)). VA Value added. Can vector (length GN) matrix (Rows x GN). X Output vector (length GN). countries Character vector country names/codes (length G). sectors Character vector sector names/codes (length N).

title: Build a bm_io object from IO table blocks — bm_build_io
text: object class "bm_io".

what: Toy 4-country, 3-sector IO table for bmGVC — bm_toy_data
title: Toy 4-country, 3-sector IO table for bmGVC — bm_toy_data
text: small multi-country input–output data set used bmGVC examples vignettes. contains four countries (China, India, Japan, ROW) three sectors (Primary, Manufacturing, Service).

title: Toy 4-country, 3-sector IO table for bmGVC — bm_toy_data
text: bm_toy_Z numeric matrix 12 x 12 bm_toy_Y numeric matrix 12 x 4 bm_toy_VA numeric vector length 12 bm_toy_X numeric vector length 12 bm_toy_countries character vector length 4 bm_toy_sectors character vector length 3

title: Toy 4-country, 3-sector IO table for bmGVC — bm_toy_data
text: data stored six objects: bm_toy_Z: 12 x 12 intermediate demand matrix bm_toy_Y: 12 x 4 final demand matrix bm_toy_VA: length-12 value-added vector bm_toy_X: length-12 gross output vector bm_toy_countries: character vector length 4 bm_toy_sectors: character vector length 3 ordering industries (China P,M,S; India P,M,S; Japan P,M,S; ROW P,M,S).
